title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as 

the Property Services 

(Regulation) Act 2011 (Minimum Standards) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 30 November 2020. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited property service (regulation) act 2011 (minimum standards) regulation 2020 (2) regulation come operation 30 november 2020 definition

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Act” means the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (No. 40 of 2011); 

“client”, for the purposes of these Regulations, includes– 

(a) 

(b) 

a person for whom a property service is provided by a licensee, 
and 
in the event of the death, insolvency or other incapacity of a 
person who falls within paragraph (a) (in this definition referred 
to as the “person concerned”)– 

(i) 

(ii) 

any person having authority to administer the estate of the 
person concerned, 
any beneficiary under a will, intestacy or trust of the 
person concerned, or 

(iii) any other personal representative of the person concerned; 

“written” or “in writing” means any expression consisting of words or figures 
which can be read, reproduced and subsequently communicated, including 
information which is transmitted and stored by electronic means. 

Registration of Business Name

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 3. (1) A licensee shall submit to the Authority, all business names used by
text_raw:
3. (1) A licensee shall submit to the Authority, all business names used by 
the licensee in the provision of a property service, not later than 10 working 
days after the registration of the business name with the Companies 
Registration Office. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 4th December, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [564] 3 

(2) Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (1), where a business 
name is already registered with the Companies Registration Office, and is 
being used by the licensee and was not previously notified to the Authority, 
such business name, shall be notified to the Authority as part of the next 
licence renewal application. 

Experience
text_norm: 3 (1) licensee shall submit authority business name used licensee provision property service later 10 working day registration business name company registration office notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 4th december 2020 564 3 (2) without prejudice generality paragraph (1) business name already registered company registration office used licensee previously notified authority business name shall notified authority part next licence renewal application experience

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 4. A licensee shall not hold himself or herself out to a client or any other
text_raw:
4. A licensee shall not hold himself or herself out to a client or any other 
person as possessing experience, competence, training or resources, including 
financial resources, in respect of the provision of a property service, which he 
or she does not possess. 

Conduct and Behaviour
text_norm: 4 licensee shall hold client person possessing experience competence training resource including financial resource respect provision property service posse conduct behaviour

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 5. (1) A licensee shall respond to all communications from a client by
text_raw:
5. (1) A licensee shall respond to all communications from a client by 

whatever means agreed with the client and within a reasonable timeframe. 

(2) A licensee in the provision of a property service shall not act in a 

manner which is unlawful. 

(3) Subject to paragraph (2), a licensee in the provision of a property 

service shall act in the interests of the client at all times. 

(4) A licensee in the provision of a property service shall not exceed the 

authority granted by the client. 

(5) A licensee shall, not later than 5 working days after receipt of a written 
request from a client, inform the client of the amount of money held in the 
client account of the licensee on behalf of that client, as at the date of the 
request. 

(6) A licensee shall not maliciously do anything, directly or indirectly, to 

injure or undermine the reputation or business of another licensee. 

Provision of Property Services by Unlicensed Persons
text_norm: 5 (1) licensee shall respond communication client whatever mean agreed client within reasonable timeframe (2) licensee provision property service shall act manner unlawful (3) subject paragraph (2) licensee provision property service shall act interest client time (4) licensee provision property service shall exceed authority granted client (5) licensee shall later 5 working day receipt written request client inform client amount money held client account licensee behalf client date request (6) licensee shall maliciously anything directly indirectly injure undermine reputation business another licensee provision property service unlicensed person

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 6. A property services employer, independent contractor or principal
text_raw:
6. A property services employer, independent contractor or principal 
officer, shall not direct or facilitate in any way an individual, including a 
principal officer or employee, who is not licensed, to provide a property service 
except where the property service comes within the exemption provided for in 
section 3(1)(o) of the Act. 

Inducement
text_norm: 6 property service employer independent contractor principal officer shall direct facilitate way individual including principal officer employee licensed provide property service except property service come within exemption provided section 3(1)(o) act inducement

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 7. (1) A licensee shall not seek or accept any form of inducement in
text_raw:
7. (1) A licensee shall not seek or accept any form of inducement in 

respect of the provision of a property service. 

(2) For the purposes of this Regulation, “inducement” means the promise, 
offer or giving, directly or through an intermediary, of a reward, advantage or 
enticement, or of a potential reward, advantage or enticement, whether 
monetary or otherwise, other than the fees agreed in the letter of engagement. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [564] 

Expenses and Fees
text_norm: 7 (1) licensee shall seek accept form inducement respect provision property service (2) purpose regulation inducement mean promise offer giving directly intermediary reward advantage enticement potential reward advantage enticement whether monetary otherwise fee agreed letter engagement 4 564 expense fee

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 8. (1) A licensee shall refund any unused advertising outlay to a client
text_raw:
8. (1) A licensee shall refund any unused advertising outlay to a client 
within the timeframe provided for in the letter of engagement or, if not 
specified, not later than 10 working days after the conclusion or termination of 
a property services agreement, or in exceptional circumstances, as soon as 
practicable thereafter. 

(2) A licensee shall not charge any fee in respect of the sale or letting of 
land or incomplete sale or letting of land, including lease preparation, tenancy 
extension or tenancy renewal, to any person other than the licensee’s client for 
the purposes of the property service concerned. 

(3) A licensee shall not express or imply, to any person that is not a client 
of the licensee, that fees, administration expenses or any other expenses due 
from the client to the licensee, in respect of the sale or letting of land, are to be 
borne by that person. 

Service Provided Without Consideration
text_norm: 8 (1) licensee shall refund unused advertising outlay client within timeframe provided letter engagement specified later 10 working day conclusion termination property service agreement exceptional circumstance soon practicable thereafter (2) licensee shall charge fee respect sale letting land incomplete sale letting land including lease preparation tenancy extension tenancy renewal person licensee client purpose property service concerned (3) licensee shall express imply person client licensee fee administration expense expense due client licensee respect sale letting land borne person service provided without consideration

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 9. Where a licensee provides a service without consideration, that would
text_raw:
9. Where a licensee provides a service without consideration, that would 
otherwise be a property service were consideration provided, the person to 
whom the service is provided and any person who is making a payment to the 
licensee related to that service, shall be informed in writing that the service 
provided is not a property service within the meaning of the Act and will not be 
subject to any protections arising under the Act. 

Provision of Information
text_norm: 9 licensee provides service without consideration would otherwise property service consideration provided person service provided person making payment licensee related service shall informed writing service provided property service within meaning act subject protection arising act provision information

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 10. (1) A licensee shall not knowingly produce, publish or circulate, or
text_raw:
10. (1) A licensee shall not knowingly produce, publish or circulate, or 
cause to be produced, published or circulated, by whatever means, false or 
misleading advertising information, including but not limited to, the following: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

sales records; 

sales prices achieved; 

experience of the licensee or any licensed principal officer or 
employee; 

(d) 

fees charged or chargeable; 

(e) 

applicable commission rates. 

(2) A licensee shall not knowingly produce, publish or circulate, or cause 
to be produced, published or circulated, by whatever means, misleading 
information in respect of land or property other than land, advertised for 
auction, sale or to let. 

(3) A licensee shall on receipt of a request in writing from— 

(a) 

(b) 

the vendor, prior to the sale of land or property other than land, 
or 
the purchaser following the sale of land or property other than 
land, 

 
 
 
 [564] 5 

remove any advertisement relevant to the land or property other than land, 
including brochures, signage, websites and portals under the control of the 
licensee, as provided for in the letter of engagement or, if not specified, not 
later than 10 working days after receipt of the request, or as soon as practical 
thereafter. 

(4) A licensee shall update any advertisement status relevant to land or 
property other than land, including brochures, signage, websites and portals 
under the control of the licensee, as provided for in the letter of engagement or, 
if not specified, not later than 10 working days after commencement of a 
tenancy or an unconditional contract for sale being completed, or as soon as 
practical thereafter. 

(5) In the event of the termination of a property services agreement, a 
licensee shall remove any advertisements relevant to the land or property other 
than land, including brochures, signage, websites and portals under the control 
of the licensee, as provided for in the letter of engagement or, if not specified, 
not later than 10 working days after the termination of the property services 
agreement, or as soon as practical thereafter. 

Breach of Letter of Engagement
text_norm: 10 (1) licensee shall knowingly produce publish circulate cause produced published circulated whatever mean false misleading advertising information including limited following (a) (b) (c) sale record sale price achieved experience licensee licensed principal officer employee (d) fee charged chargeable (e) applicable commission rate (2) licensee shall knowingly produce publish circulate cause produced published circulated whatever mean misleading information respect land property land advertised auction sale let (3) licensee shall receipt request writing from-- (a) (b) vendor prior sale land property land purchaser following sale land property land 564 5 remove advertisement relevant land property land including brochure signage website portal control licensee provided letter engagement specified later 10 working day receipt request soon practical thereafter (4) licensee shall update advertisement status relevant land property land including brochure signage website portal control licensee provided letter engagement specified later 10 working day commencement tenancy unconditional contract sale completed soon practical thereafter (5) event termination property service agreement licensee shall remove advertisement relevant land property land including brochure signage website portal control licensee provided letter engagement specified later 10 working day termination property service agreement soon practical thereafter breach letter engagement

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 11. A licensee shall not breach the terms of the letter of engagement, or
text_raw:
11. A licensee shall not breach the terms of the letter of engagement, or 
other contract or agreement, or any terms of agency with his or her client, in 
respect of the provision of a property service. 

Accepting Tenants
text_norm: 11 licensee shall breach term letter engagement contract agreement term agency client respect provision property service accepting tenant

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 12. A licensee shall ensure that, where agreed with the client, prior to a
text_raw:
12. A licensee shall ensure that, where agreed with the client, prior to a 

tenant signing a tenancy agreement— 

(a) 

(b) 

such references as have been agreed have been received, and 

such reasonable checks as have been agreed have been 
conducted in respect of the validity of such references. 

Timeframe to Transfer Payments in Relation to Tenancy
text_norm: 12 licensee shall ensure agreed client prior tenant signing tenancy agreement-- (a) (b) reference agreed received reasonable check agreed conducted respect validity reference timeframe transfer payment relation tenancy

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 13. A licensee who receives a payment from a tenant on behalf of a client,
text_raw:
13. A licensee who receives a payment from a tenant on behalf of a client, 
shall transfer the payment to an account nominated by the client within such 
timeframe as agreed with the client in the letter of engagement or, if not 
specified, not later than 30 days after receipt of the payment. The payment 
shall be without deduction, unless instructed in writing by the client to make 
such deduction, or as otherwise provided for by contract or letter of 
engagement between the licensee and the client. 

Notification of Termination of Tenancy
text_norm: 13 licensee receives payment tenant behalf client shall transfer payment account nominated client within timeframe agreed client letter engagement specified later 30 day receipt payment payment shall without deduction unless instructed writing client make deduction otherwise provided contract letter engagement licensee client notification termination tenancy

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 14. A licensee shall notify a client in writing, within a reasonable
text_raw:
14. A licensee shall notify a client in writing, within a reasonable 

timeframe, on becoming aware that— 

(a) 

the client’s tenant has indicated his or her intention to terminate 
the tenancy, or 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [564] 

(b) 

the client’s tenant has terminated the tenancy. 

Offers to Purchase (Private Treaty) or to Rent
text_norm: 14 licensee shall notify client writing within reasonable timeframe becoming aware that-- (a) client tenant indicated intention terminate tenancy 6 564 (b) client tenant terminated tenancy offer purchase (private treaty) rent

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 15. (1) Subject to paragraph (3), a licensee shall disclose to a client who has
text_raw:
15. (1) Subject to paragraph (3), a licensee shall disclose to a client who has 
engaged the licensee for the purpose of the sale of land, other than by auction, 
or letting of land, by the means and within such timeframe as is agreed with the 
client, all offers to purchase or rent the land, including any conditions attaching 
to the offers, and all recorded price offers on the land, unless otherwise 
instructed in writing by the client. 

(2) A licensee shall in respect of all offers to purchase land, other than by 
auction, or to rent land, provide written confirmation to each offeror on receipt 
of his or her offer. 

(3) A licensee shall not express or imply to any person, including a client 
or his or her representative, that an offer has been received unless that offer has 
been received by the licensee. 

(4) When disclosing an offer to purchase or to rent to a client under this 

Regulation, a licensee shall notify the client in writing that the offeror is— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the licensee, 

a principal officer of the licensee, 

an employee of the licensee, 

(d) 

the employer of the licensee, 

(e) 

an employee of the licensee’s employer, or 

(f) 

a connected relative of any person referred to in subparagraphs 
(a) to (e), 

where the licensee knows or has reasonable grounds to believe that this is the 
case. 

Deposits
text_norm: 15 (1) subject paragraph (3) licensee shall disclose client engaged licensee purpose sale land auction letting land mean within timeframe agreed client offer purchase rent land including condition attaching offer recorded price offer land unless otherwise instructed writing client (2) licensee shall respect offer purchase land auction rent land provide written confirmation offeror receipt offer (3) licensee shall express imply person including client representative offer received unless offer received licensee (4) disclosing offer purchase rent client regulation licensee shall notify client writing offeror is-- (a) (b) (c) licensee principal officer licensee employee licensee (d) employer licensee (e) employee licensee employer (f) connected relative person referred subparagraphs (a) (e) licensee know reasonable ground believe case deposit

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 16. (1) Where a licensee holds a security deposit (or any part thereof), in
text_raw:
16. (1) Where a licensee holds a security deposit (or any part thereof), in 
relation to the letting of land, which is due to be paid to a client or returned to a 
tenant, the licensee shall make such payment to the client or tenant as provided 
for in the letter of engagement or, if not specified, not later than 10 working 
days after the day the tenant vacates the property, save in exceptional 
circumstances. 

(2) Where a licensee holds a booking deposit in relation to the sale of land 
(or any part thereof), which is due to be paid to the client, the licensee shall 
make such payment on written instruction from the client or the client’s 
solicitor, not later than 10 working days after receipt of the instruction, save in 
exceptional circumstances. 

(3) Where a licensee holds a booking deposit in relation to the sale of land 
(or any part thereof) which is due to be refunded to a person other than a client, 
the licensee shall make such payment not later than 10 working days after the 

 
 
 
 [564] 7 

day on which the refund is due to be refunded, save in exceptional 
circumstances. 

(4) A licensee shall not hold more than one booking deposit in relation to 

the sale of the same land at any given time, without reasonable cause. 

Service Charges and Sinking Fund Contributions
text_norm: 16 (1) licensee hold security deposit (or part thereof) relation letting land due paid client returned tenant licensee shall make payment client tenant provided letter engagement specified later 10 working day day tenant vacates property save exceptional circumstance (2) licensee hold booking deposit relation sale land (or part thereof) due paid client licensee shall make payment written instruction client client solicitor later 10 working day receipt instruction save exceptional circumstance (3) licensee hold booking deposit relation sale land (or part thereof) due refunded person client licensee shall make payment later 10 working day 564 7 day refund due refunded save exceptional circumstance (4) licensee shall hold one booking deposit relation sale land given time without reasonable cause service charge sinking fund contribution

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 17. (1) A licensee who is administering the collection of service charges or
text_raw:
17. (1) A licensee who is administering the collection of service charges or 
sinking fund contributions, on behalf of a management body of a multi-unit 
development, shall take all reasonable steps to collect the service charges and 
sinking fund contributions, as provided for in the letter of engagement or, if not 
specified, as instructed in writing by the client. 

(2) A licensee who administers the collection of service charges or sinking 
fund contributions, on behalf of a management body of a multi-unit 
development, shall transfer all such monies to the relevant account of the 
management body, within the timeframe provided for in the letter of 
engagement or, if not specified, not later than 30 days after receipt of the 
monies. 

Director of a Management Body of a Multi-Unit Development
text_norm: 17 (1) licensee administering collection service charge sinking fund contribution behalf management body multi-unit development shall take reasonable step collect service charge sinking fund contribution provided letter engagement specified instructed writing client (2) licensee administers collection service charge sinking fund contribution behalf management body multi-unit development shall transfer monies relevant account management body within timeframe provided letter engagement specified later 30 day receipt monies director management body multi-unit development

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 18. (1) A licensee or a principal officer or employee of a licensee, shall not
text_raw:
18. (1) A licensee or a principal officer or employee of a licensee, shall not 
be a director of a management body of a multi-unit development, where 
property management services are provided to that management body by— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the licensee, 

an employee of the licensee, 

the employer of the licensee, 

(d) 

an employee of the licensee’s employer, or 

(e) 

a licensee who is a beneficial owner of a company which is 
providing the property service. 

(2) Where a licensee, or a principal officer or employee of a licensee is, on 
the making of these Regulations, a director of a management body of a multiunit development, and is in a position which would place him or her in breach 
of paragraph (1), the licensee shall resign as director at the earliest opportunity, 
but no later than the next annual general meeting of the body. 

(3) Nothing in paragraph (1) or (2) shall prevent a licensee or a principal 
officer or employee of a licensee who is a unit owner in a multi-unit 
development from becoming a director of, or providing a property service to, 
the management body of that development. 

Financial or Other Services
text_norm: 18 (1) licensee principal officer employee licensee shall director management body multi-unit development property management service provided management body by-- (a) (b) (c) licensee employee licensee employer licensee (d) employee licensee employer (e) licensee beneficial owner company providing property service (2) licensee principal officer employee licensee making regulation director management body multiunit development position would place breach paragraph (1) licensee shall resign director earliest opportunity later next annual general meeting body (3) nothing paragraph (1) (2) shall prevent licensee principal officer employee licensee unit owner multi-unit development becoming director providing property service management body development financial service

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 19. A licensee shall not make the sale of land to a person conditional upon
text_raw:
19. A licensee shall not make the sale of land to a person conditional upon 
the licensee, or a subsidiary or associated body of the licensee, providing a 
financial service or other service relating to land, to that person. 

 
 
 
 
 8 [564] 

Engagement of Legal Advisors
text_norm: 19 licensee shall make sale land person conditional upon licensee subsidiary associated body licensee providing financial service service relating land person 8 564 engagement legal advisor

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: 20. A licensee shall not make the provision of any of the following—
text_raw:
20. A licensee shall not make the provision of any of the following— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the auction of property other than land, 

the purchase or sale, by whatever means, of land, 

the letting of land, or 

(d) 

the provision of property management services, 

conditional on the vendor, purchaser, lessor, lessee, tenant or directors of a 
management body of a multi-unit development, being represented by any 
particular legal advisor or firm of legal advisors. 

Conflict of Interest
text_norm: 20 licensee shall make provision following-- (a) (b) (c) auction property land purchase sale whatever mean land letting land (d) provision property management service conditional vendor purchaser lessor lessee tenant director management body multi-unit development represented particular legal advisor firm legal advisor conflict interest

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: A licensee shall inform the client in writing, as soon as is reasonably
text_raw:
21. 

 A licensee shall inform the client in writing, as soon as is reasonably 
possible on becoming aware of any conflict of interest, or potential conflict of 
interest, in relation to the provision of a property service. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [564] 9 

The Minister for Justice consents to the making of the foregoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 November, 2020. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

Given under the seal of the Property Services Regulatory Authority 
 27 November, 2020 

MAEVE HOGAN, 
 Chief Executive, Property Services Regulatory Authority. 

GERALDINE CLARKE 
 Chairperson, Property Services Regulatory Authority.

title: conferred on it by section 95 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations lay down standards to be observed by licensed property 
services providers under the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 in the 
provision of property services. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [564] 11
